title: Mason Cycles Bokeh 3.5 Features UDH and More Tire Clearance
content:
Mason Cycles’ made in Italy aluminum Bokeh – the English brand’s fast gravel bicycle – has received a fresh update, with a UDH rear end, new color, and more tire clearance. Let’s check it out…

John reviewed the Bokeh last year, where it was his fast-paced, “wide-open” gravel bike in Southern Arizona during the winter months. Since then, the brand has been working hard to increase the capabilities of this aluminum chassis gravel machine.

Mason Bokeh 3.5

This update – known internally at Mason as the Bokeh 3.5 – is the most recent stage of a ten-year evolution. The Bokeh’s evolution from a fast gravel bike to a more adventure-capable platform has culminated in version 3.5.

Pricing

The Mason Bokeh is available with a variety of groupsets, wheels, and component options. Multiple versions of the Bokeh can be configured via the Mason website or through direct discussion with Mason to create a truly custom spec.

Example prices:

  • Bokeh Frameset, with RangeFinder AS carbon fork – £1,450 inc. VAT
  • Bokeh Shimano GRX – from £2,850 inc. VAT
  • Bokeh SRAM Rival AXS XPLR – from £3,600 inc. VAT
  • Bokeh Campagnolo Ekar – from £3,600 inc. VAT

New UDH-Compatible Dropouts

The Bokeh’s new Mason-designed dropouts are forged and machined in Italy, where they are welded onto the custom Dedecciai aluminium tubing. The result is a future-proof replacement of mech hangers; the UDH standard enables compatibility with SRAM’s Transmission series of directly-mounted mechs. The new Bokeh is now compatible with all derailleur systems, giving riders maximum choice between SRAM, Shimano, and other component options.

Increased Tire Clearance

The Bokeh has always been designed to work with 700c or 650b wheels, giving riders a choice between fast-rolling speed and go-anywhere abilities. The new Bokeh 3.5 moves towards the very best of both worlds, boosting tyre clearance for 700c wheels to 50mm. With 650B wheels installed, tyre clearance is 55mm, the extra volume and width bringing increased confidence, comfort, and control in challenging off-road conditions.

New Bokeh Color Option: FilterYellow

Of all the colors in the Mason palette, few have gathered as much attention as FilterYellow. Since its launch on bikes like the steel Exposure adventurer and Raw mountain bike, this rich mustardy tone has caught eyes and turned heads. Now, to help mark the 10th birthday of perhaps Mason’s best-known and most widely loved model, the Bokeh is also available in FilterYellow – alongside OpticGreen, SensorBlue, and Sepia.

Check out more information about the Bokeh updates at Mason Cycles.
